org.raistlic.common.permutation

Interface Combination.Algorithm

  • Enclosing class:
    Combination<E>

    public static interface Combination.Algorithm
    A callback interface that implements the combination algorithm.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void fetchCombination(java.lang.Object[] source, java.lang.Object[] target, java.math.BigInteger ordinal)
      Fills the target array with selected elements in the source array, as the result of the ordinal-th combination result.
      java.math.BigInteger getCombinationCount(int numberOfElements, int numberToPick)
      Returns the number of all possible combinations, for picking numberToPick elements from a collection of size numberOfElements.
      default int getMaxSupportedSize()
      Returns the maximum size of collection that the algorithm implementation supports, it is Integer.MAX_VALUE by default.

    • Method Detail

      • getMaxSupportedSize

        default int getMaxSupportedSize()
        Returns the maximum size of collection that the algorithm implementation supports, it is Integer.MAX_VALUE by default.
        Returns:
        the maximum size of collection that the algorithm implementation supports.

      • getCombinationCount

        java.math.BigInteger getCombinationCount(int numberOfElements,
                                         int numberToPick)
        Returns the number of all possible combinations, for picking numberToPick elements from a collection of size numberOfElements.
        Parameters:
        numberOfElements - the collection size, must be no less than 0 .
        numberToPick - the number of elements to pick, must be no less than 0 and no more than numberOfElements .
        Returns:
        the number of all possible combinations.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - when numberOfElements or numberToPick is invalid.

      • fetchCombination

        void fetchCombination(java.lang.Object[] source,
                      java.lang.Object[] target,
                      java.math.BigInteger ordinal)
        Fills the target array with selected elements in the source array, as the result of the ordinal-th combination result.
        Parameters:
        source - the source array, cannot be null
        target - the target array, cannot be null, and it's size cannot be bigger than source .
        ordinal - the index of the combination result to pick, must be no less than 0 and must be less than getCombinationCount(source.length, target.length) .
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - when any of the parameters is invalid.
